author: Tomek Legutko
comment: It's simple and convenient. You can change slides with your phone's volume buttons while screen's turned off. Setup is super easy, server-side app is available as chrome extension, so I'm happy as a Linux user that I don't' need to install Windows-only server (as in most other remote controllers apps). Great app!

author: Camille Acey
comment: Advancing slides with a Samsung S6 and Chrome on MacOSX worked fine. But I can't go back using the volume down button. Am I doing something wrong? Will try on Linux.

author: Normen Yu
comment: Simple, very easy to use. Requires inputting very few information to use both on the computer and in the app. Especially helpful when you are awkwardly setting up on a foreign computer and everyone is waiting for you to get started.

author: Gabriel Evangelista
comment: Previous slide (volume down) doesn't work as stated. Other than that, nice app. Fix this bug and I'll give 5stars

author: Bryan Warren
comment: Set up is easy. Next slide(volume up) works fine. However,  the previous slide(volume down) does not seem to be working. Galaxy S7.
title: Previous slide was not work

author: Christopher Dalporto
comment: Well I guess it didn't really, but I had the best presentation because of this app. Don't give presentations clicking your number keys like a tard, get this app! Thank you!
title: Saved my life!!!!

author: Dawid Drozd
comment: Works. Simply works ;) But i have problems that sound regulation shows up and when i want fast click it consumes clicks  So i must click / per second

author: Sergio Amorim
title: Does all of it should do!

author: Jacem Chaieb
comment: Not fully working. The button on the notification works fine, but the volume buttons are not working (To be precise, only the volume up works, once, when pressed again it won't work, the volume down is not working either).  I have downloaded the source code and compiled it my self, the first time it sends NEXT to the backend, but then I always get a GoogleAuthIOException.

reply.author: Pablo Gil
reply.content:
Hi Jacem,

what device are you using?

Regarding compilation yourself, it's probably failing because you are using your development key to sign the package and then testing against the production server.

author: Christopher Smy
comment: Does exactly what it needs to, really straightforwardly. Android wear support works, but a little less reliably.  I'm going to stick with my phone for now.

author: Iain Johnson
comment: Exactly what I needed - brilliant. Would give it 6 stars if it somehow connected via Bluetooth but i'm not even sure that's possible.
